article_text:
Palladium prices jumped to nearly a one-year high, as tensions between Russia and the West raised the specter of a possible supply disruption.

Russia is the world's biggest supplier of the precious metal, a key component of exhaust filters that keep cars running cleanly. Some investors are betting that fears about the potential interruption of Russian palladium shipments will keep prices high in the $3.2 billion futures market if the...

twitter.description: Palladium prices jumped to nearly a one-year high on Thursday, as tensions between Russia and the West raised the specter of a possible supply disruption.
twitter.title: Supply Fears Lift Palladium

image.alt: Palladium prices jump on fears of possible disruption of Russian shipments.
